intro: Chrysobaphus, commonly known as the golden baphus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. They are typically found in temperate regions, often growing in moist, shaded environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Chrysobaphus plants are also noted for their aromatic properties and potential medicinal uses.
